li.a: 2019-2020 HISD Calendar (Posted 3/26/19) Changes possible if state changes testing week!

div.p: Primary Goal 1: Increase Student Performance HISD student performance will demonstrate growth evidenced on state and national standardized assessments, thus narrowing achievement gaps to graduate all students equipped for college and career readiness. Any grade level, or subject with more than an 8% achievement gap will be targeted for improvement.

Supporting Goal 2: Create and Support a Positive District Culture Through clear articulation of the district’s mission, HISD will create a powerful sense of community and shared direction among personnel, parents, students, and the public. Parent and community input is valued and utilized to improve a sense of cooperation. Realizing the value of our human assets, HISD will work to attract and retain the best teachers and staff members while creating an environment in which they may flourish. * Evidence of attainment -- Employee satisfaction survey will be utilized annually to evaluate and improve employee satisfaction. The survey will address employee perceptions of job satisfaction, professional development, work environment, and ask for input in areas identified as in need of improvement.
Supporting Goal 3: Provide for Technology Enhanced Learning HISD will provide students with technology integrated instruction and learning opportunities in all classes.

Supporting Goal 4: Improve Public Support, Confidence, and Communication The schools of Hemphill ISD belong to the citizens of our district, hence the board, administration, and support staff are public servants charged to support the schools and the relationship between teachers, students, and parents. Public confidence regarding thte safety and security of our students and staff is our top priority. Support increases as a result of district transparency, all-inclusive accountability, effective communication, and meaningful community engagement. * Evidence of attainment -- Parent/community survey will be utilized annually to evaluate and improve community relations. The survey will address community perceptions of safety, communication, and transparency and ask for input in areas identified as in need of improvement.

div.div: The mission of the Hemphill Independent School District is to equip all students in a safe learning environment with the skills necessary to lead productive and satisfying lives.

div.p: THIS TAX RATE WILL RAISE MORE TAXES FOR MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS THAN LAST YEAR'S TAX RATE.
THE TAX RATE WILL EFFECTIVELY BE RAISED BY 0 PERCENT AND WILL RAISE TAXES FOR MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS ON A $ 100,000 HOME BY APPROXIMATELY $ -70.00.

p.span: Governor Abbott has extended the school closure through May 4. If HISD is able to return at this time we will have a staff work day on Monday, May 4th and resume classes on Tuesday, May 5th. For the month of April our campuses will continue to provide remote instructional services for our students and the lunch program will continue as long as we are allowed by our state and federal officials. Please stay safe and continue to follow the directives and advice of the CDC and government officials during this critical time of the COVID-19 pandemic.

span.strong:
As of Monday, March 30th, HISD will have lunches available to be picked up in the following areas:
Frontier Park 10:30 to 10:50 and
New Hope Baptist Church 11:00 to 11:20
Six Mile SRA Boat Ramp (North side of the bridge near Family Dollar) 10:30-10:50; and Community Fellowship Church in Fairmount 11:00-11:20
HISD Bus Lane behind cafeteria 10-12.
Lunches will be available for pickup at these locations Monday-Thursday. If you would like your child to receive a lunch at one of these locations please call 409.787.3371 ext 2518. Please call in by 9:30a.m. daily, leave a voice message to include your name, phone number, number of lunches needed, and site for pick-up. Lunches are for anyone 18 or younger.

span.a: Financial Assistance for Texas Families Poster

div.p:
HISD is continuing to closely monitor the COVID-19 pandemic while following the guidance of the CDC and TEA. There are no reports of COVID-19 cases in our community at this time and HISD is planning to continue with classes on Tuesday.
If you, your child or any member of your family has the coronavirus, COVID-19, exhibits any symptoms such as fever or respiratory conditions or been exposed to these conditions, traveled to areas of known cases or come into contact with anyone who has, please keep your child home and consult with your physician.
We also respect the concerns of our parents while providing for safety and the best education for all students. Children of parents wishing to keep their children at home may be excused by accessing supplemental assignments electronically or picking up assignments from the front office of their child’s campus. More information will be posted on our website tomorrow afternoon, Monday, March 16.

div.div: I would like to first express my extreme gratitude for the work of all of our HISD staff to ensure our student's educational needs are met to the best of our abilities during this unprecedented time. ...Read more...

The April board meeting will be held on April 30. Public attendance will be limited to an electronic format and instructions for participating will be posted on our website the week of the meeting.Read more...

Students who will be attending the 7th grade in the fall of 2019 need to have the following required vaccines. They should have a Meningococcal (MCV4) on or after the 11th birthday and a Tdap booster ...Read more...
